location showing how it appears with its surroundings.
T. Applicants for transmission towers shall hold a community meeting prior to the date of the special use
permit public hearing by the Town Council. Notice of the location, date, and time of the community
meeting shall be mailed to the owners of any property located within five hundred (500) feet of the
subject parcel of land as well as to the neighborhood or homeowners' association representing any
property located within five hundred (500) feet of the subject parcel as identified by the Planning
Department.
U. Decisions to approve or deny proposals for new telecommunications towers shall be rendered by the
Town Council within one hundred fifty (150) days from a complete application submittal.
V. Tower Removal and Decommissioning Plan Requirement. The applicant shall be required to submit a
plan defining the conditions upon which decommissioning will be initiated. Notice shall be provided
to the Zoning Administrator when the tower is place out of service. Towers which are not used for a
period of six (6) months or more shall be removed by the property owner within 120 days. Further, a
form of surety equal to 100% of the cost of decommissioning under the plan, as estimated by a N.C.
licensed engineer (plans shall be sealed), and approved by the Zoning Administrator and Town
Attorney, either through cash, a surety bond, irrevocable letter of credit or other instrument readily
convertible into cash at face value, either with the Town or in escrow with a financial institution
designated as an official depository of the Town. This surety shall be retained by the Town to cover
all cost of the decommissioning requirements.
